description: From Middle English *cowardly (adjective) and cowardly (adverb), equivalent to coward +â€Ž -ly. Displaced native Old English earg.

adjectives.description: cowardly (comparative cowardlier or more cowardly, superlative cowardliest or most cowardly)

entries.meaning: Showing cowardice; lacking in courage; weakly fearful.

adverbs.description: cowardly (comparative more cowardly, superlative most cowardly)

entries.meaning: (archaic) In the manner of a coward, cowardlily.
